_header: Saint George the holy man as we findeth I-write
Subjects: saints’ lives; George, saint, life of
_description: Life of St. George in the South English Legendary — couplets

BodAsh43.First Lines:
SEyn Iorge þe holi mon as we fyndeþ iwriteIn þe lond
                    of capadoce ibore was & biȝitte…
BodAsh43.Last Lines:
…þer he is in grete Ioie þat last wiþþouten
                    endeNou god uor þe loue of him ous let alle þuder
                    wende

Bod779.First Lines:
Seint iorge þe holyman as we fyndeȝ I wryteIn þe
                    lond of capadocye I bore he was & by ȝete…
Bod779.Last Lines:
…& þere he is in gret ioye þat last wit outen
                    ende& god for þe loue of sent iorge vs lete alle þedir
                    wende

BodEngPoeta1.First Lines:
SEint George þe holi Mon as we fyndeþ i writeIn þe
                    Lond of Capadose i boren he was and bi ȝite…
BodEngPoeta1.Last Lines:
…Þer he is in gret Ioye þat lasteþ wiþ outen
                    endeNow God for seynt George loue vs leeue þider wende.
                    Amen.
BodEngPoeta1.Facsimiles:
Doyle,  I. A.,
                        ed.  
             The Vernon Manuscript. A Facsimile of Bodleian Library, Oxford, MS Eng.
                poet.a.1,
          with an introduction by A. I. Doyle. Cambridge: D. S. Brewer, 1987. 
Scase,  Wendy,  and  Nick Kennedy, eds.  
             A facsimile edition of the Vernon manuscript: Oxford, Bodleian Library, MS. Eng. Poet. A. 1.
         Oxford: The Bodleian Library, 2011.

BodLauMis108.First Lines:
SEint George þe holie man ase we findeȝ i writeIn þe
                    londe of Cappadoce he was i bore and bi ȝite…
BodLauMis108.Last Lines:
…Þare he is in grete Ioye þat last with outen
                    endeNov god for seint Georges loue late ore soule þudere
                    wende
BodLauMis108.Editions:
Horstmann,  Carl,
                        ed.  
             The Early South-English Legendary.
EETS
         o.s. 87 (1887; repr. 1987): 294-6.

BodLauMis463.First Lines:
SEint George þe holi man as we finde writeIn þe lond of
                    Capadoce y bore was & riȝite…
BodLauMis463.Last Lines:
…þere he is in gret Ioye þat lasteþ wiþ outen
                    endeNou god for sent George loue vs lete alle þider wende
BodLauMis463.Note: Two columns per page, one full-line, the other half-line.

BodRawPoe225.First Lines:
A þou tretour sayd dacyanWilt þou al way take on
                    so…
BodRawPoe225.Last Lines:
…Whan dacian sey þis don y wisHis wittes were nyȝk
                    hym be nome

BodTan17.First Lines:
SEint George þe holi man as we fynde writeIn þe lond of
                    capadoce I bore he was & be ȝite…
BodTan17.Last Lines:
…þere he is in gret ioye þat lasteþ euere wiþ
                    outen endeGor for seint georges loue lete vs alle þidir
                    wende

OxfTri57.First Lines:
Seint George þe holy man as we fyndeþ y writeIn þe
                    lond of Cappodoce y bore was & by ȝyte…
OxfTri57.Last Lines:
…þere he ys in gret ioye þat lasteþ withoute
                    endeNow god for seint Georgis sone vs lete alle þuþer
                    wende
OxfTri57.Attributed Title:
Vita sancti Georgii (rubric marginal heading by scribe, f. 32);
                        Georgius (RT)

CamCCC145.First Lines:
Sein Gorge þe holy man as we vindeþ iwriteIn þe lond
                    of capadose ybore was and bi ȝute…
CamCCC145.Last Lines:
…þer he is in grete ioye þat last wiþ oute
                    endeNou god for sein Gorges loue us lete al þuder wende

D’Evelyn,  Charlotte,  and  A. J. Mill, eds.

CamKC13.First Lines:
SEint George þe holi man as we findeþ of him y writeIn
                    þe lond of Capadoce y bore was and bi ȝute…
CamKC13.Last Lines:
…Þer he his in gret ioie þat lasteþ wiþ oute
                    endeNow god for seint Georges loue lede vs alle þider
                    wende

BLCottJulDIX.First Lines: SEint george þe holiman as we findeþ ywriteIn þe lond of capadoce ibore was & biȝite…
BLCottJulDIX.Last Lines: …þer he is in gret ioie þat lasteþ withouten enþenou god for seint georges loue ous late al þeþer wende
BLCottJulDIX.Note: “Capitulum xxxii” added to right margin by later hand (f. 63).

BLEge2810.First Lines: SEint george þe holiman as we vindiþ ywriteIn ve londe of capadoce hij bore he was & byȝete…
BLEge2810.Last Lines: …;þere he is in gret ioye þat lestiþ wyþoute endeNou god for þe loue of him ous lete alle þidir wende

BLEge2891.First Lines: SEin George þe holie man as we findeþ iwriteIn þe lond of capadose Ibore was and bi ȝute…
BLEge2891.Last Lines: …þare he is in gret ioieþat last wiþ oute endeNou god for sein georges loue us lete alle þuder wende

BLHar2277.First Lines: SEint George þe holi man as we fyndeþ iwriteIn þe londe of Capadoce ibore was & biȝitte…
BLHar2277.Last Lines: …þer he is wiþ grete ioye þat euermo ilesteþ wiþouten endeNou god for þe loue of Seint George ous lete þider wende
BLHar2277.Note: In penultimate line “euermo” written and expunged after “ilesteþ”; ends “amen.”
BLHar2277.Facsimiles:
Digital Facsimile of British Library Harley MS 2277.
         https://www.bl.uk/manuscripts/FullDisplay.aspx?index=0&ref=Harley_MS_2277.

Lam223.First Lines:
SAynt George þe holy knyȝt þat regned here biforeIn
                    þe lond of Capadoce was þat gode mon born…
Lam223.Last Lines:
…And þere he lenges euer in ioye þat lestes withouten
                    endeGod for saynt Georges love þou graunte vs þider to wende
                    Amen

TokyoTak54.First Lines:
Seynt George þe holy man as we finde iwriteIn þe londe of
                    Capadoce ibore was & biȝete…
TokyoTak54.Last Lines:
…Ther is in gret Ioye þat lasteth wiþout endeNow god
                    for þe loue of hym lat vs all þidere wende. Amen.
